A C D F G I M S

S

Session - Class in <Unnamed>
This class holds the methods for controlling sessions

The class variables request, EID, UID, session are declared as static because, the same copy of these variable must be accessed by all of the instances.
Session() - Constructor for class Session
 
setVariables(HttpServletRequest, String, String) - Static method in class Session
This method sets the variables request, EID(staff_id) and UID(staff_username) which are used to assign set attributes.
sign_in - Class in <Unnamed>
Servlet implementation class sign_in

This servlet has login page in the doGet method and based on the input it checks if the user is valid or not, if valid, then creates a session and show the appropriate data.
sign_in() - Constructor for class sign_in
 
sign_off - Class in <Unnamed>
Servlet implementation class sign_off

This servlet invalidates the session and redirect to sign_off html page.
sign_off() - Constructor for class sign_off
 
startSession() - Static method in class Session
This method starts the session and set Session attributes EID and UID where EID hold staff_id and UID holds Staff_username of the user signed in.
status_update - Class in <Unnamed>
Servlet implementation class status_update

This servlet check the session is valid or not, if valid, then allow the user to update the status of assignment by submitting form to status_update_reply.
status_update() - Constructor for class status_update
 
status_update_reply - Class in <Unnamed>
Servlet implementation class status_update_reply

This servlet check the session is valid or not, if valid, then show the update operation reply and allow the user to update the status of assignment.
status_update_reply() - Constructor for class status_update_reply
 
stopSession() - Static method in class Session
This method is used to invalidate the session.
